de.erichseifert.gral.util

Class StatefulTokenizer.Rule

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.erichseifert.gral.util.StatefulTokenizer.Rule
  • Enclosing class:
    StatefulTokenizer

    protected static class StatefulTokenizer.Rule
extends java.lang.Object
    A regular expression based rule for building a parsing grammar. It stores a regular expression pattern for matching input data, a type for tokens generated by this rule, and an optional name of a grammar state that should be activated. The method getToken(String,int) can be used to process input data: If the rule matches a token is returned, otherwise null will be returned.

      Initializes a new instance with the specified regular expression pattern, a type for generated tokens.

      Initializes a new instance with the specified regular expression pattern, a type for generated tokens, and a name of a grammar state that should be triggered.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      StatefulTokenizer.Token getToken(java.lang.String data, int pos)
      Analyzes the specified input data starting at the given position and returns a token with the defined type, the content matched by the regular expression if the rule matches.

    • Constructor Detail

      • StatefulTokenizer.Rule

        public StatefulTokenizer.Rule(java.lang.String pattern,
                      java.lang.Object tokenType,
                      java.lang.String nextState)
        Initializes a new instance with the specified regular expression pattern, a type for generated tokens, and a name of a grammar state that should be triggered.
        Parameters:
        pattern - A regular expression pattern string.
        tokenType - The type for the tokens generated by this rule.
        nextState - The grammar state that should be used next to analyze the input data if the rule matched.

      • StatefulTokenizer.Rule

    • Method Detail

      • getToken

        public StatefulTokenizer.Token getToken(java.lang.String data,
                               int pos)
        Analyzes the specified input data starting at the given position and returns a token with the defined type, the content matched by the regular expression if the rule matches. If the rule doesn't match null will be returned.
        Parameters:
        data - Input data.
        pos - Position to start looking for a match.
        Returns:
        A token with information about the matched section of the input data, or null if the rule didn't match.
